Articles.Content:
NOTE: This station uses mods. However, I am open to stock modules too, so you do not need to download any of the mods I use.

Without further ado, I present to you a project involving the whole forums, or atleast whoever want's to participate.

Before we get to station building, I have a poll based on where we should put the station. The further away it is from Kerbin, the harder it will be to put it in and other modules in orbit. However it will be easier to gain science. Yes, that's right, we are using science as points. However, we have all the parts unlocked. Science is just used as a points system. So, I'll be putting a poll up which will let you vote.

I will design very few modules peronally, one being the core, and some others I feel are necessary.

11-15-2014:

UPDATE 1: We have a stunning amount of contributers. If anyone wants to supply a powerful booster, that'd be great! I may add support to FusTek and ExtraPlanetary Launchpads.

UPDATE 2: LKO it is! I'm launching the station core up now.

UPDATE 3: The core is now in orbit. Took a few tries to make a really crappy booster that finally got the core into orbit. It has 6 docking ports, 1 on the bottom, 1 on the top, and 4 on the side. Unfortunately, I forgot to put on transmitters to recieve science. We will fix that later. For now, Our two brave kerbalnauts, Bill and Bob are up on the station keeping things running. I didn't exactly realize how fast 8 photovaltaic solar panels could charge the core. It would be nice to have a module to store power though.

UPDATE 4: Kethane and Extraplanetary Launchpad mods now supported!

11-28-14:

Update 5: Hehe, I kind of forgot about this project... Sorry... And due to high request, it's now completely stock.

EDIT: What should we name the station? Suggest names, and I'll choose one I like most. For now I'm naming it KSP Station.

Station right now: (2 modules)

Edited November 28, 2014 by Clockwork13

If you contribute a module, I'll save it to the VAB and name it after your forum username.

We need the following parts to start off. Post here and tell me if you want to contribute to one or more.

2 habitation modules

3 science modules

1 core (DONE)

2 power modules

Powerful boosters are also needed.

CURRENT MODULES:

  1. Core - Contains 8 2x3 solar panels, 2 kerbals, 2 large monoproppellant tanks, and 6 docking ports.

Edited November 28, 2014 by Clockwork13
Maybe around Laythe? Or Gilly, because then you can have EVA excursions.
But if my request is not votable, I'm going for Duna, just because it adds a little bit more challenge.

Maybe around Laythe? Or Gilly, because then you can have EVA excursions.

I thought about further out bodies too, and Laythe no doubt would be cool. However, those bodies are simply put too far out to be a good place to build a station around. Gilly's atmosphere is too weak to hold a station I'm assuming. However, we could use the station to construct bases and more space stations around those bodies.
You mean something like my old Stock Community Space Station? Count me in! I'll put up a big fuel depot, i have a lifter that can put 300 tonnes into orbit.

You mean something like my old Stock Community Space Station? Count me in! I'll put up a big fuel depot, i have a lifter that can put 300 tonnes into orbit.

Nice! And I have seen a few other projects like this, but I decided to make my own, because I wasn't sure if any of the threads were still active.

You mean something like my old Stock Community Space Station? Count me in! I'll put up a big fuel depot, i have a lifter that can put 300 tonnes into orbit.

I think that I could build some pretty heavy lifters too.

Nice! And I have seen a few other projects like this, but I decided to make my own, because I wasn't sure if any of the threads were still active.

None of them are active, but i'd love to help with a new one IT used to be so busy, we'd be booked for a full month of launches It was so cool....
I'll donate an escape pod module if desired

You mean something like my old Stock Community Space Station? Count me in! I'll put up a big fuel depot, i have a lifter that can put 300 tonnes into orbit.

I think that I could build some pretty heavy lifters too.

I'll donate an escape pod module if desired

Lol, not sure how much an escape pod is needed, but it may be useful if any launches containing Kerbals happen to fail.
It needs power, and I'll be willing to stick some Gigantors up there!
Anyway, it's getting late where I live, I'll start building in Ã‚Â±8 hours.

Anyway, it's getting late where I live, I'll start building in Ã‚Â±8 hours.

haha, sounds good I will as well....

Or i could just throw this up again.... the ARES Duna Station.

It needs power, and I'll be willing to stick some Gigantors up there!

That would be great for the near future, but when I launch the core up, it will have a starting amount of power to prevent going inoperable.

NEWS FLASH: The core is now in orbit. Took a few tries to make a really crappy booster that finally got the core into orbit. It has 6 docking ports, 1 on the bottom, 1 on the top, and 4 on the side. Unfortunately, I forgot to put on transmitters to recieve science. We will fix that later. For now, Our two brave kerbalnauts, Bill and Bob are up on the station keeping things running. I didn't exactly realize how fast 8 photovaltaic solar panels could charge the core. It would be nice to have a module to store power though
Well, I'm awake, expect the first uploads in about 1,5 hours. My first upload will most likely be a heavy lifter, so save it as a subassembly.
Well, I think that the first lifter is done.
Here is the link: https://www.dropbox.com/s/e0qr2xcpj1eo8at/Heavy%20lifter%20mk1%20-%20kopie.craft?dl=0
By the way, clockwork13, could you give us some pictures of the station?

By the way, clockwork13, could you give us some pictures of the station?

I added a pic of the station so far, containing 2 modules. Also thanks for the booster!

EDIT: Oh my. Just tested the booster and it has enough power to blast you out of the Kerbol system even using the most inefficient method on the planet (the one I used...)

If we were going to Laythe (which we may in the future), then this booster would definitely be a huge help.

Edited November 16, 2014 by Clockwork13

I added a pic of the station so far, containing 2 modules. Also thanks for the booster!

EDIT: Oh my. Just tested the booster and it has enough power to blast you out of the Kerbol system even using the most inefficient method on the planet (the one I used...)

If we were going to Laythe (which we may in the future), then this booster would definitely be a huge help.

Yeah, it's a little bit overpowered.

Awww, we're using EPL?

I've got no clue how to use that mod. But I suppose I could download it.

*cough*

*cough*

I could also stick a Spaceplane Dock and 2.5 meter Hub Connector up. (As demonstrated in the pic)

*Note that they would not look like they do in the pic, it's just for a visualization.
FYI there would be a lot more people doing this if you made it stock... mods just tend to limit the number of people.
